IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: JOHN JAY COLLEGE FOUNDATION, INC. CONDUCTS FUND-RAISING ACTIVITIES IN SUPPORT OF JOHN JAY COLLEGE AND ITS VARIOUS EDUCATIONAL, CULTURAL AND SOCIAL ACTIVITIES.
IRS990.MissionDesc: JOHN JAY COLLEGE FOUNDATION, INC. CONDUCTS FUND-RAISING ACTIVITIES IN SUPPORT OF JOHN JAY COLLEGE AND ITS VARIOUS EDUCATIONAL, CULTURAL, AND SOCIAL ACTIVITIES.
IRS990.Desc: THE FOUNDATION CONDUCTS FUNDRAISING ACTIVITIES TO BENEFIT THE JOHN JAY COLLEGE OF CRIMINAL JUSTICE EDUCATIONAL, CULTURAL AND SOCIAL ACTIVITIES. IN FISCAL YEAR 2023, THE FOUNDATION RAISED MONEY AND PROVIDED SUPPORT TOWARDS THE JOHN JAY COLLEGE OF CRIMINAL JUSTICE'S STUDENT SCHOLARSHIP, FELLOWSHIP AND GRANT AWARDS, AS WELL AS SUPPORT FOR RESEARCH ACTIVITIES.

BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: HELEN CEDENO CO JOHN JAY COLLEGE

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FOUNDATION'S ENDOWMENTS CONSIST OF NINE DONOR-RESTRICTED ENDOWMENT FUNDS: ART AND JUSTICE ENDOWED SCHOLARSHIP PRE-LAW INSTITUTE RUBIE AND JAMES MALONE ENDOWED SCHOLARSHIP JEANNETTE K. WATSON ENDOWED SCHOLARSHIP DUANE M. AND LILY E. CHRIST HI-TECH PREP MATHEMATICS SCHOLARSHIP LABRENDA GARRETT NELSON CHILDREN'S CENTER ENDOWED SCHOLARSHIP FORENSIC PSYCHOLOGY INSTITUTE, STUDENT SUPPORT AND CLINICAL TRAINING DOCTORAL PROGRAM CON EDISON ENDOWED SCHOLARSHIP JOE BROGAN CONSTITUTIONAL POLICING SCHOLARSHIP ENDOWED FUND ENDOWED FUNDS ARE USED TO SUPPORT STUDENT SCHOLARSHIPS AND RELATED PROGRAMS, SUCH AS NETWORKING, WORKSHOPS, AND STUDENT PRESENTATIONS.

THE FOUNDATION IS EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL INCOME TAXES UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3)OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE (THE CODE); THEREFORE, NO PROVISION FOR INCOME TAXES IS REFLECTED IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THE FOUNDATION HAS BEEN CLASSIFIED AS A PUBLICLY SUPPORTED ORGANIZATION THAT IS NOT A PRIVATE FOUNDATION UNDER SECTION 509(A) OF THE CODE. THE FOUNDATION PRESENTLY DISCLOSES OR RECOGNIZES INCOME TAX POSITIONS BASED ON MANAGEMENT'S ESTIMATE OF WHETHER IT IS REASONABLY POSSIBLE OR PROBABLE THAT A LIABILITY HAS BEEN INCURRED FOR UNRECOGNIZED INCOME TAXES. MANAGEMENT HAS CONCLUDED THAT THE FOUNDATION HAS TAKEN NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT REQUIRE ADJUSTMENT IN ITS FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. U.S. FORMS 990 FILED BY THE FOUNDATION ARE SUBJECT TO EXAMINATION BY TAXING AUTHORITIES.

STUDENT SCHOLARSHIPS ARE ISSUED ON CERTAIN STIPULATIONS RECEIVED FROM DONORS AND OR CERTAIN CRITERIA DEVELOPED BY THE JOHN JAY COLLEGE OF CRIMINAL JUSTICE SCHOLARSHIP'S COMMITTEE. THE FACULTY AWARD IS BASED ON CERTAIN CRITERIA AS REQUESTED BY THE DONOR. GRANTS ARE FULFILLED ON STIPULATIONS REQUESTED BY DONORS. SCHOLARSHIPS ARE MONITORED BY THE SCHOLARSHIP COORDINATOR OF THE COLLEGE'S SCHOLARSHIPS COMMITTEE. GRANTS ARE MONITORED BY THE COLLEGE'S OFFICE OF SPONSORED RESEARCH. SCHOLARSHIPS AND GRANTS MAY ALSO BE MONITORED BY ADMINISTRATORS IDENTIFIED BY THE DONOR.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VII, SECTION A, LINE 5:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: KETURA PARKER SERVES AS EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR OF THE FOUNDATION; HER COMPENSATION IS PAID BY JOHN JAY COLLEGE. ANNUAL SALARY IS $192,438. THIS COMPENSATION IS INCLUDED IN CONTRIBUTED NON-FINANCIAL ASSETS ON THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FORM 990 IS COMPLETED BY THE INDEPENDENT AUDIT FIRM. THE FORM IS PRELIMINARILY REVIEWED BY THE ACCOUNTING OFFICE. THEREAFTER, THE FOUNDATION'S AUDIT COMMITTEE MEETS WITH THE INDEPENDENT AUDIT FIRM TO REVIEW THE DOCUMENT IN ENTIRETY. IF THERE ARE NO CHANGES, FORM 990 IS THEN CIRCULATED TO THE FOUNDATION'S BOARD FOR REVIEW AND APPROVAL BEFORE THE RETURN IS FILED WITH THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION REGULARLY AND CONSISTENTLY MONITORS AND ENFORCES COMPLIANCE WITH ITS CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY. THE FOUNDATION'S TRUSTEES ARE ASKED TO SIGN THE DOCUMENTS ONCE A YEAR AND THE STATEMENTS ARE REVIEWED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. IF A CONFLICT ARISES, THE BOARD DETERMINES WHETHER THE JOHN JAY COLLEGE FOUNDATION CAN PROCEED WITH A TRANSACTION BASED ON THE UNDERLYING FACTS AND CIRCUMSTANCES. THE AFFECTED BOARD MEMBER IS ABSOLVED FROM VOTING ON THE MOTION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND FINANCIAL STATEMENT AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON A WRITTEN REQUEST.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART IX, LINE 7, COLUMN B:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION REIMBURSED JOHN JAY COLLEGE OF CRIMINAL JUSTICE FOR GRANT-FUNDED PERSONNEL COSTS THAT PROVIDED SUPPORTIVE SERVICES FOR STUDENT ADVISEMENT, RETENTION AND COLLEGE COMPLETION IN GRANT-FUNDED STUDENT SUCCESS PROGRAMS.
THIS PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.
